name: Jasmine Energy
headline: Jasmine is a decentralized market for climate assets
description: Jasmine makes the buying and selling of renewable energy assets easy, accessible, and transparent.

founders.name: Nathalie Capati, Founder
founders.description:
Forbes 30 under 30 in Energy. Previous apple engineer on special projects. 
Primary inventor of highly modular, energy storage systems.

Battery systems engineer turned crytpo fanatic during the pandemic - fun story ask me about how I got into it. I'm now obsessed with creating a liquid market for renewable energy credits to help lower the cost of capital for renewable energy projects. 

Love to talk about crypto, climate and electric cars.

founders.name: Matt Mayberry, Founder
founders.description: on a relentless mission to see what man can make of man üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è

#### Get the best team in RECs, simplified.

#### Simple Contracting
No hidden fees. Straight forward pricing for any system size and any number of credits.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64518acf6ff643a3765d4d91/649a50840ed3d115a45a0497_Marblegeo.jpg)

Get started quickly with just one document. Send us your solar contract or installation agreement and we‚Äôll take it from there.

![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64518acf6ff643a3765d4d91/64a34dce83069fcc0beb7899_plug-connected-x.svg)

No paperwork. Payments to you are convenient, safe and fast.

###### Guided Tour
#### Get a guided tour of the future.
#### Schedule a demo with one of our founders.
[Schedule a Demo](http://www.jasmine.energy/</contact>)[Schedule a Demo![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64518acf6ff643a3765d4d91/648775e01ec3a8d3448bfbd8_interface-icon-arrow-right-small-sage.svg)](http://www.jasmine.energy/<https:/preview.webflow.com/preview/rebase-template?utm_medium=preview_link&utm_source=designer&utm_content=rebase-template&preview=aade0180373b3f4b67bd218cf8f74045&pageId=63d83e100135b1241c1b77dc&workflow=preview>)
#### Common Questions
##### What is an renewable energy certificate (REC)? 
A renewable energy certificate (REC), also known as an energy attribute certificate (EAC), is a tradable instrument that represents the environmental attributes of 1 megawatt-hour (MWh) of electricity generated from a renewable energy source like wind, solar, biomass, etc. RECs allow renewable energy generation to be tracked and traded separately from the underlying electricity. [Read more from the EPA.](http://www.jasmine.energy/<https:/www.epa.gov/green-power-markets/renewable-energy-certificates-recs>)
##### How are RECs created and tracked?
RECs are issued by regional tracking systems when 1 MWh of renewable electricity is generated and delivered to the grid. Most are run by government bodies and the correct registry must be used to qualify for the highest rates. Accounts on these registries can cost thousands of dollars per year. Jasmine will take care of this registration process for you.
##### Who buys RECs and why?
Utilities, businesses, and individuals can purchase RECs to meet renewable energy goals or compliance obligations like renewable portfolio standards. By purchasing RECs, they can claim to have used that quantity of renewable electricity, even if their local grid mix does not physically deliver it.
##### Is a REC different form an EAC, SREC, or GO?
Energy Attribute Certificates (EACs) is the more generic term. In the US they're most often referred to as Renewable Energy Certificates (RECs). In some states, RECs from solar generators are called Solar RECs (SRECs). In Europe, EACs are referred to as Guarantee of Origin (GOs). In many developing countries, they're called International RECs IRECs). Some countries have their own specific term as well (ex JRECs in Japan). [Read more from the EPA.](http://www.jasmine.energy/<https:/www.epa.gov/green-power-markets/renewable-energy-certificates-recs>)
##### Do RECs expire?
Yes. Generally, RECs must be claimed within 90 days of electricity generation and those RECs become useless after about 2 years. To avoid letting your RECs expire, [**claim them now.**](http://www.jasmine.energy/<https:/www.phase4.energy/get-a-quote>)
##### How much are RECs worth?
The value of a REC can range from $2 to more than $400 depending on a number of factors including the time and location of generation. To see how these factors effect your RECs, [**get a free quote now.**](http://www.jasmine.energy/<https:/www.phase4.energy/get-a-quote>)
##### Who qualifies for RECs?
Every grid connected generator is entitled to RECs; even home solar. Jasmine handles to cumbersome process of getting these RECs issued and sold for you. We also manage any additional registrations of certifications required to maximize the RECs value to you.
##### Can anyone buy/sell/own EACs?
Yes. Anyone who generates renewable electricity (including with rooftop solar) can generate and sell EACs. Anyone can also buy and retire EACs for their personal energy consumption.
##### How does net-metering effect RECs?
Generators earn RECs for every watt of power they generate, whether they consume that power or sell it to a utility. Net metering has no effect on the number of RECs you are entitled to.

#### Common Questions
##### What is an renewable energy certificate (REC)? 
A renewable energy certificate (REC), also known as an energy attribute certificate (EAC), is a tradable instrument that represents the environmental attributes of 1 megawatt-hour (MWh) of electricity generated from a renewable energy source like wind, solar, biomass, etc. RECs allow renewable energy generation to be tracked and traded separately from the underlying electricity. Read more from the EPA.‚ü®19‚ü©
##### How are RECs created and tracked?
RECs are issued by regional tracking systems when 1 MWh of renewable electricity is generated and delivered to the grid. Most are run by government bodies and the correct registry must be used to qualify for the highest rates. Accounts on these registries can cost thousands of dollars per year. Jasmine will take care of this registration process for you.
##### Who buys RECs and why?
Utilities, businesses, and individuals can purchase RECs to meet renewable energy goals or compliance obligations like renewable portfolio standards. By purchasing RECs, they can claim to have used that quantity of renewable electricity, even if their local grid mix does not physically deliver it.
##### Is a REC different form an EAC, SREC, or GO?
Energy Attribute Certificates (EACs) is the more generic term. In the US they're most often referred to as Renewable Energy Certificates (RECs). In some states, RECs from solar generators are called Solar RECs (SRECs). In Europe, EACs are referred to as Guarantee of Origin (GOs). In many developing countries, they're called International RECs IRECs). Some countries have their own specific term as well (ex JRECs in Japan). Read more from the EPA.‚ü®19‚ü©
##### Do RECs expire?
Yes. Generally, RECs must be claimed within 90 days of electricity generation and those RECs become useless after about 2 years. To avoid letting your RECs expire, **claim them now.**‚ü®20‚ü©
##### How much are RECs worth?
The value of a REC can range from $2 to more than $400 depending on a number of factors including the time and location of generation. To see how these factors effect your RECs, **get a free quote now.**‚ü®20‚ü©
##### Who qualifies for RECs?
Every grid connected generator is entitled to RECs; even home solar. Jasmine handles to cumbersome process of getting these RECs issued and sold for you. We also manage any additional registrations of certifications required to maximize the RECs value to you.
##### Can anyone buy/sell/own EACs?
Yes. Anyone who generates renewable electricity (including with rooftop solar) can generate and sell EACs. Anyone can also buy and retire EACs for their personal energy consumption.
##### How does net-metering effect RECs?
Generators earn RECs for every watt of power they generate, whether they consume that power or sell it to a utility. Net metering has no effect on the number of RECs you are entitled to.

generated_description:
### Jasmine Energy: Simplifying Climate Assets in a Decentralized Market

Founded in 2022 and nestled in the heart of Washington, DC, Jasmine Energy stands out as a decentralized marketplace dedicated to climate assets. Initially focused on making the buying and selling of renewable energy assets straightforward, Jasmine has evolved into a pivotal platform enabling transparency and accessibility in renewable energy exchanges.

Being part of Y Combinator's Batch S22 lends credibility, and with a nimble team of six, Jasmine is poised for growth. Leading the charge is Gustaf Alstromer, their Group Partner, who adds significant value to the company's vision.

#### What Jasmine Energy Does

Jasmine specializes in managing Renewable Energy Certificates (RECs)‚Äîan essential component of the renewable energy ecosystem. They simplify the cumbersome processes involved in registration, data management, and broker transactions of RECs. The platform takes care of the regulatory paperwork and ensures that users get paid smoothly‚Äîso much so that all you have to do is register your solar system (for free) and watch the magic happen.

Their user-friendly approach means you can easily verify generator information, compare prices, and buy or trade any volume of energy credits. Jasmine ensures no hidden fees creep in, offering transparent pricing and straightforward contracting that caters to various capacities.

#### Audience and Services

Jasmine Energy tailors its services to three main groups:

1. **Homeowners with Rooftop Solar** - Aimed at maximizing the value of their energy production while managing RECs efficiently.
2. **Third-Party Owners (TPO)** - For those owning small-scale solar systems, Jasmine offers a way to manage RECs with ease.
3. **Independent Power Producers (IPP)** - Catering to utility-scale producers by optimizing REC value and handling the bureaucratic load.

Each category has tailored fee structures, designed to ensure that users can capitalize on their contributions to green energy.

#### Why It Matters

At its core, Jasmine Energy is not just about trading energy certificates; it‚Äôs about building a more transparent and inclusive market for climate assets. With a focus on decentralization and accessibility, they aim to democratize the renewable energy landscape.

Their intuitive platform aligns perfectly with the growing demand for sustainable energy solutions, reflective of a shifting societal mindset toward environmental responsibility. The potential to trade energy credits effectively could pave the way for broader adoption of renewable sources.

In conclusion, Jasmine Energy is a forward-thinking startup with its finger on the pulse of the renewable energy sector. By leveraging technology to simplify access to climate assets, they're contributing to a more sustainable future‚Äîone certificate at a time. Check them out at [www.jasmine.energy](http://www.jasmine.energy) to learn more about joining their mission.
